item.title: Could you decentralize everything? YES....AND...!
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Could you build everything so it's decentralized and verifiable?
  • Could we have the people's bandwidth?
  • Could we have the people's DNS?
  • Could we host the "master" our stuff locally but have it served by other nodes when our "master" nodes goes down?
  • I don't see why not. Again it will be slower but it's worth it!

item.title: Slack bot chat interface for replying to Google Play Store reviews?!?!
item.description:
Pontifications

The following is just a thought experiment:

  • DM a bot to ask for reviews to reply e.g. /review
    • maybe you get 5-10 reviews
    • emoji for skip, emoji for spam, emoji for nonsense reviews
    • reply to a review via slack's reply feature
  • DM the same bot to ask for reviews to moderate e.g. /moderate
  • emoji for skip, emjoi for thumbs up, emoji for thumbs down, can, maybe have a command for editing, a review reply

Pros

  • userids are taken care of
  • easy text driven interface, works wherever slack works, i.e. on mobile, on desktop, etc
  • emojis are fun :-)

Cons

  • you need a slack id which might be limited in supply, maybe just do this for moderating?

item.title: MongoDB: When comparing dates of type DateTime you need to convert strings to ISODate
item.description:
Pontifications

  • i.e. the following MongoDB query doesn't work:
{"Developer Reply Text": {$ne: null}, 'developer_last_updated_time': 
  {$gte:  "2018-05-16T00:00:00Z"}}
  • but the following does work
{"Developer Reply Text": {$ne: null}, 'developer_last_updated_time': {$gte: { $date: "2018-05-16T00:00:00Z"} }}
  • this also works and is the form I prefer since it seems less complicated to me:
{"Developer Reply Text": {$ne: null}, 'developer_last_updated_time': {
  '$gte': ISODate("2018-05-16T00:00:00Z") }}

item.title: The People's Internet: Good stuff as well as bad stuff of course!
item.description:
Pontifications

  • The people's internet will be overlayed on top of the existng commercial internet I wrote yesterday .
  • This doesn't mean it's full of bad stuff or questionable stuff. It can and should be just as diverse and a force for good.

item.title: The People's Internet: Slow, decentralized and not subject to takedown
item.description:
Pontifications

  • The people's internet will be overlayed on top of the existng commercial internet.
  • It will be slow, encrypted, decentralized and not subject to takedown which can happen at any layer with the commercial internet (DNS, WiFi, Wireless, servers, clouds, etc etc)

item.title: Mikeysax: How to install MongoDB 3.6 on Windows 10 Subsystem for Linux
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Mikeysax's gist: From Install Mongo with WSL for Windows.

QUOTE

sudo apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 --recv 2930ADAE8CAF5059EE73BB4B58712A2291FA4AD5
echo "deb [ arch=amd64,arm64 ] https://repo.mongodb.org/apt/ubuntu xenial/mongodb-org/3.6 multiverse" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mongodb-org-3.6.list
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y mongodb-org

This will install the most stable version of mongod, 3.6 at time of writing. If you want to install a different version please refer to the link above.

END QUOTE

item.title: Potential TensorFlow project: Use Human in the loop to train on 50 or less Firefox for Android Google Play Store reviews for positive and negative sentiment and keyword extraction?!?
item.description:
Pontifications

  • I think sentiment is definitely doable with TensorFlow
  • Not sure about keyword extraction, it might just be word clustering?!?
  • How many reviews would have to be randomly sampled? Maybe 50 per month in English?
  • Can do this in German and other languages, right?
